channel.title: Codeforces on Roman Kurnovskii
channel.description: Recent content in Codeforces on Roman Kurnovskii

item.title: Python template for contests
item.description: 1import math 2import os 3import sys 4import time 5from collections import defaultdict, Counter 6 7 8INF = sys.maxsize 9 10# ------ INPUTS 11 12inp = lambda: sys.stdin.readline().strip().rstrip("\r\n") #read line as string. Ex: input 1 2 3 => '1 2 3' 13inpi = lambda: int(inp()) #read input as integer. input 1 => 1 14inpl = lambda: list(map(int, inp().split())) #read line as list of integers. Ex: [1, 2, 3] 15inp_strl = lambda: list(inp().split()) #read line as list of strings.

item.title: Round #849/1791 (Div. 4)
item.description: Contest date: 2023-02-03 Contest problems Editorial A. Codeforces Checking https://codeforces.com/contest/1791/problem/A Solution: 1def solve(letter): 2 code = "codeforces" 3 if letter in code: 4 print("YES") 5 else: 6 print("NO") 7 8for _ in range(int(input())): 9 letter = input() 10 solve(letter) B. Following Directions https://codeforces.com/contest/1791/problem/B geometry, implementation, *800 Solution: 1def solve(n, s): 2 x = 0 3 y = 0 4 for move in s: 5 if move == 'L': 6 x -= 1 7 elif move == 'R': 8 x += 1 9 elif move == 'U': 10 y += 1 11 elif move == 'D': 12 y -= 1 13 if x == 1 and y == 1: 14 print("YES") 15 break 16 else: 17 print("NO") 18 19for _ in range(int(input())): # attempts 20 num = int(input()) 21 letter = input() 22 solve(num, letter) C.
